Detailed Description

ELM APIs.

This file contains the device abstraction layer APIs for ELM.

Macro Definition Documentation

#define ELM_AUTOGATING_OCP_FREE   (0)

Macros which can be used as 'configVal' parameter to elmAutoGatingConfig API.

OCP clock is free-running

#define ELM_AUTOGATING_OCP_GATING   (1)

Automatic internal OCP clock gating strategy is applied based on the OCP interface activity

#define ELM_BIT_DISABLE   (0U)

Disables a bit of ELM register

#define ELM_BIT_ENABLE   (1U)

Enables a bit of ELM register

#define ELM_BIT_SET_HIGH   (1U)

Sets a bit of ELM register to high

#define ELM_BIT_SET_LOW   (0U)

Sets a bit of ELM register to low

#define ELM_CLOCKACTIVITYOCP_OCP_OFF   (0)

OCP clock is switch off

#define ELM_CLOCKACTIVITYOCP_OCP_ON   (1)

Macros which can be used as 'configVal' parameter to elmOCPClkActivityConfig API.

OCP Clock is maintained during wake up period

#define ELM_ECC_BCH_LEVEL_16BITS   (2U)

BCH level for Upto 16 bits error correction

#define ELM_ECC_BCH_LEVEL_4BITS   (0U)

Macros which can be used as 'bchECCLevel' parameter to elmErrCorrectionLevelSet API.

BCH level for Upto 4 bits error correction

#define ELM_ECC_BCH_LEVEL_8BITS   (1U)

BCH level for Upto 8 bits error correction

#define ELM_ERROR_NUM_0   (0U)

Macros which can be used as 'errNum' parameter to elmErrLocBitAddrGet API.

Indicates 0th error of ELM

#define ELM_ERROR_NUM_1   (1U)

Indicates 1st error of ELM

#define ELM_ERROR_NUM_10   (10U)

Indicates 10th error of ELM

#define ELM_ERROR_NUM_11   (11U)

Indicates 11th error of ELM

#define ELM_ERROR_NUM_12   (12U)

Indicates 12th error of ELM

#define ELM_ERROR_NUM_13   (13U)

Indicates 13th error of ELM

#define ELM_ERROR_NUM_14   (14U)

Indicates 14th error of ELM

#define ELM_ERROR_NUM_15   (15U)

Indicates 15th error of ELM

#define ELM_ERROR_NUM_2   (2U)

Indicates 2nd error of ELM

#define ELM_ERROR_NUM_3   (3U)

Indicates 3rd error of ELM

#define ELM_ERROR_NUM_4   (4U)

Indicates 4th error of ELM

#define ELM_ERROR_NUM_5   (5U)

Indicates 5th error of ELM

#define ELM_ERROR_NUM_6   (6U)

Indicates 6th error of ELM

#define ELM_ERROR_NUM_7   (7U)

Indicates 7th error of ELM

#define ELM_ERROR_NUM_8   (8U)

Indicates 8th error of ELM

#define ELM_ERROR_NUM_9   (9U)

Indicates 9th error of ELM

#define ELM_IDLEMODE_FORCEIDLE   (0)

Macros which can be used as 'configVal' parameter to elmIdleModeSelect API.

For selecting force-idle mode

#define ELM_IDLEMODE_NOIDLE   (1)

For selecting no-idle mode

#define ELM_IDLEMODE_SMARTIDLE   (2)

For selecting smart-idle mode

#define ELM_INT_DISALBLE   (0U)

Disables ELM interrupts

#define ELM_INT_ENALBLE   (1U)

Macros which can be used as 'flag' parameter to elmIntConfig API.

Enables ELM interrupts

#define ELM_LOC_VALID_0_STATUS   (0U)

Macros which can be used as 'flag' parameter to elmIntStatusGet API.

Error-location status for syndrome polynomial 0

#define ELM_LOC_VALID_1_STATUS   (1U)

Error-location status for syndrome polynomial 1

#define ELM_LOC_VALID_2_STATUS   (2U)

Error-location status for syndrome polynomial 2

#define ELM_LOC_VALID_3_STATUS   (3U)

Error-location status for syndrome polynomial 3

#define ELM_LOC_VALID_4_STATUS   (4U)

Error-location status for syndrome polynomial 4

#define ELM_LOC_VALID_5_STATUS   (5U)

Error-location status for syndrome polynomial 5

#define ELM_LOC_VALID_6_STATUS   (6U)

Error-location status for syndrome polynomial 6

#define ELM_LOC_VALID_7_STATUS   (7U)

Error-location status for syndrome polynomial 7

#define ELM_MODE_CONTINUOUS   (0U)

Macros which can be used as 'mode' parameter to elmModeSet API.

Enables continuous mode of ELM module

#define ELM_MODE_PAGE   (1U)

Enables page mode of ELM module

#define ELM_PAGE_VALID_STATUS   (8U)

Error-location status for a full page

#define ELM_PAGEMODE_SECTOR_0   (0U)

Macros which can be used as 'sectorNum' parameter to elmModeSet API.

For selecting syndrome polynomial 0 as part of the page in page mode

#define ELM_PAGEMODE_SECTOR_1   (1U)

For selecting syndrome polynomial 1 as part of the page in page mode

#define ELM_PAGEMODE_SECTOR_2   (2U)

For selecting syndrome polynomial 2 as part of the page in page mode

#define ELM_PAGEMODE_SECTOR_3   (3U)

For selecting syndrome polynomial 3 as part of the page in page mode

#define ELM_PAGEMODE_SECTOR_4   (4U)

For selecting syndrome polynomial 4 as part of the page in page mode

#define ELM_PAGEMODE_SECTOR_5   (5U)

For selecting syndrome polynomial 5 as part of the page in page mode

#define ELM_PAGEMODE_SECTOR_6   (6U)

For selecting syndrome polynomial 6 as part of the page in page mode

#define ELM_PAGEMODE_SECTOR_7   (7U)

For selecting syndrome polynomial 7 as part of the page in page mode

#define ELM_SYNDROME_FRGMT_0   (0U)

Macros which can be used as 'synFrgmtId' parameter to elmSyndromeFrgmtSet API.

Selects syndrome fragment 0 for error-location processing

#define ELM_SYNDROME_FRGMT_1   (1U)

Selects syndrome fragment 1 for error-location processing

#define ELM_SYNDROME_FRGMT_2   (2U)

Selects syndrome fragment 2 for error-location processing

#define ELM_SYNDROME_FRGMT_3   (3U)

Selects syndrome fragment 3 for error-location processing

#define ELM_SYNDROME_FRGMT_4   (4U)

Selects syndrome fragment 4 for error-location processing

#define ELM_SYNDROME_FRGMT_5   (5U)

Selects syndrome fragment 5 for error-location processing

#define ELM_SYNDROME_FRGMT_6   (6U)

Selects syndrome fragment 6 for error-location processing

#define hElmCfg   ((CSL_elmRegs *)CSL_ELM_0_CFG_REGS)

Handle to access ELM registers.

Typedef Documentation

typedef CSL_elmRegs* elmHandle

ELM Handle

Function Documentation

void elmAutoGatingConfig ( uint32_t  baseAddr,
uint32_t  configVal 
)

This function configs the Internal OCP clock gating strategy.
.

Parameters
baseAddrMemory address of the ELM.
configValConfig value for OCP clk gating.
This can take one of the following values :
ELM_AUTOGATING_OCP_FREE – OCP clock is free-running
ELM_AUTOGATING_OCP_GATING – Automatic internal OCP clock gating strategy is applied based on the OCP interface activity.
Returns
none.
void elmECCSizeSet ( uint32_t  baseAddr,
uint32_t  eccSize 
)

This function sets the size of the buffers for which the error-location engine is used.
.

Parameters
baseAddrMemory address of the ELM.
eccSizeeccSize in number of nibbles (i.e 4-bits entities).
Returns
None.
void elmErrCorrectionLevelSet ( uint32_t  baseAddr,
uint32_t  eccLevel 
)

This function sets the Error correction level for BCH alogorithm.
.

Parameters
baseAddrMemory address of the ELM.
bchECCLevelBCH error correction level.
This can take one of the following values :
ELM_ECC_BCH_LEVEL_16BITS : For Upto 16 bits error correction.
ELM_ECC_BCH_LEVEL_8BITS : For Upto 8 bits error correction.
ELM_ECC_BCH_LEVEL_4BITS : For Upto 4 bits error correction.
Returns
None.
uint32_t elmErrLocBitAddrGet ( uint32_t  baseAddr,
uint32_t  errNum,
uint32_t  csNum 
)

This function gets the Error-location bit address for the error number passed.
.

Parameters
baseAddrMemory address of the ELM.
errNumError number.
This can take one of the following values :
ELM_ERROR_NUM_0 - For 0th error.
ELM_ERROR_NUM_1 - For 1th error.
ELM_ERROR_NUM_2 - For 2th error.
ELM_ERROR_NUM_3 - For 3th error.
ELM_ERROR_NUM_4 - For 4th error.
ELM_ERROR_NUM_5 - For 5th error.
ELM_ERROR_NUM_6 - For 6th error.
ELM_ERROR_NUM_7 - For 7th error.
ELM_ERROR_NUM_8 - For 8th error.
ELM_ERROR_NUM_9 - For 9th error.
ELM_ERROR_NUM_10 - For 10th error.
ELM_ERROR_NUM_11 - For 11th error.
ELM_ERROR_NUM_12 - For 12th error.
ELM_ERROR_NUM_13 - For 13th error.
ELM_ERROR_NUM_14 - For 14th error.
ELM_ERROR_NUM_15 - For 15th error.
csNumChip Select Number, 0 - 7.
Returns
Bit address for the error number.
void elmErrLocProcessingStart ( uint32_t  baseAddr,
uint32_t  csNum 
)

This function starts the error-location processing for the polynomial set in the syndrome fragment registers.
.

Parameters
baseAddrMemory address of the ELM.
csNumChip Select Number, 0 - 7.
Returns
None.
uint32_t elmErrLocProcessingStatusGet ( uint32_t  baseAddr,
uint32_t  csNum 
)

This function gets the error-location processing status.
.

Parameters
baseAddrMemory address of the ELM.
csNumChip Select Number, 0 - 7.
Returns
status.
0 : ECC error-location process failed.
1 : ECC error-location process passed.
void elmIdleModeSelect ( uint32_t  baseAddr,
uint32_t  mode 
)

This function sets the idle mode for ELM.
.

Parameters
baseAddrMemory address of the ELM.
modeIdle mode.
This can take one of the following values :
ELM_IDLEMODE_FORCEIDLE – for force-idle.
ELM_IDLEMODE_NOIDLE – for no-idle.
ELM_IDLEMODE_SMARTIDLE – for smart-idle.
Returns
none.
void elmIntConfig ( uint32_t  baseAddr,
uint32_t  intFlag,
uint32_t  configVal 
)

This function configs i.e enables or disables the interrupts.
.

Parameters
baseAddrMemory address of the ELM.
intflagintFlag for which interrupt has to config.
This can take one of the following values :
ELM_LOC_VALID_0_STATUS : Error-location interrupt for syndrome polynomial 0.
ELM_LOC_VALID_1_STATUS : Error-location interrupt for syndrome polynomial 1.
ELM_LOC_VALID_2_STATUS : Error-location interrupt for syndrome polynomial 2.
ELM_LOC_VALID_3_STATUS : Error-location interrupt for syndrome polynomial 3.
ELM_LOC_VALID_4_STATUS : Error-location interrupt for syndrome polynomial 4.
ELM_LOC_VALID_5_STATUS : Error-location interrupt for syndrome polynomial 5.
ELM_LOC_VALID_6_STATUS : Error-location interrupt for syndrome polynomial 6.
ELM_LOC_VALID_7_STATUS : Error-location interrupt for syndrome polynomial 7.
ELM_PAGE_VALID_STATUS : Error-location interrupt for a full page.
configValConfig Value.
This can take one of the following values :
ELM_INT_ENALBLE : To enble the interrupt
ELM_INT_DISALBLE : To disable the interrupt.
Returns
None.
void elmIntStatusClear ( uint32_t  baseAddr,
uint32_t  flag 
)

This function clears the interrupt.
.

Parameters
baseAddrMemory address of the ELM.
flagFlag for which interrupt status has to clear.
This can take one of the following values :
ELM_LOC_VALID_0_STATUS : Error-location interrupt for syndrome polynomial 0.
ELM_LOC_VALID_1_STATUS : Error-location interrupt for syndrome polynomial 1.
ELM_LOC_VALID_2_STATUS : Error-location interrupt for syndrome polynomial 2.
ELM_LOC_VALID_3_STATUS : Error-location interrupt for syndrome polynomial 3.
ELM_LOC_VALID_4_STATUS : Error-location interrupt for syndrome polynomial 4.
ELM_LOC_VALID_5_STATUS : Error-location interrupt for syndrome polynomial 5.
ELM_LOC_VALID_6_STATUS : Error-location interrupt for syndrome polynomial 6.
ELM_LOC_VALID_7_STATUS : Error-location interrupt for syndrome polynomial 7.
ELM_PAGE_VALID_STATUS : Error-location interrupt for a full page.
Returns
None.
uint32_t elmIntStatusGet ( uint32_t  baseAddr,
uint32_t  flag 
)

This function gets Interrupt status.
.

Parameters
baseAddrMemory address of the ELM.
flagFlag for which interrupt status has to get.
This can take one of the following values :
ELM_LOC_VALID_0_STATUS : Error-location status for syndrome polynomial 0.
ELM_LOC_VALID_1_STATUS : Error-location status for syndrome polynomial 1.
ELM_LOC_VALID_2_STATUS : Error-location status for syndrome polynomial 2.
ELM_LOC_VALID_3_STATUS : Error-location status for syndrome polynomial 3.
ELM_LOC_VALID_4_STATUS : Error-location status for syndrome polynomial 4.
ELM_LOC_VALID_5_STATUS : Error-location status for syndrome polynomial 5.
ELM_LOC_VALID_6_STATUS : Error-location status for syndrome polynomial 6.
ELM_LOC_VALID_7_STATUS : Error-location status for syndrome polynomial 7.
ELM_PAGE_VALID_STATUS : Error-location status for a full page.
Returns
intSts Interrupt Status. Return value meaning depends on the param flag.
If flag is ELM_LOC_VALID_i_STATUS where i = 0 to 7, then
0 : No syndrome processed or process in progress.
1 : Error-location process completed.
If flag is ELM_PAGE_VALID_STATUS, then
0 : Error locations invalid for all polynomials enabled.
1 : All error locations valid.
void elmModeSet ( uint32_t  baseAddr,
uint32_t  mode,
uint32_t  sectorNum 
)

This function sets mode of the ELM module.
.

Parameters
baseAddrMemory address of the ELM.
modemode of the ELM.
This can take one of the following values :
ELM_MODE_PAGE – For page mode.
ELM_MODE_CONTINUOUS – For continuous mode.
sectorNumSector number or syndrome polynomial number which has to select as part of the page in page mode.
This can take one of the following values :
ELM_PAGEMODE_SECTOR_0 – For selecting syndrome polynomial 0 as part of the page in page mode.
ELM_PAGEMODE_SECTOR_1 – For selecting syndrome polynomial 1 as part of the page in page mode.
ELM_PAGEMODE_SECTOR_2 – For selecting syndrome polynomial 2 as part of the page in page mode.
ELM_PAGEMODE_SECTOR_3 – For selecting syndrome polynomial 3 as part of the page in page mode.
ELM_PAGEMODE_SECTOR_4 – For selecting syndrome polynomial 4 as part of the page in page mode.
ELM_PAGEMODE_SECTOR_5 – For selecting syndrome polynomial 5 as part of the page in page mode.
ELM_PAGEMODE_SECTOR_6 – For selecting syndrome polynomial 6 as part of the page in page mode.
ELM_PAGEMODE_SECTOR_7 – For selecting syndrome polynomial 7 as part of the page in page mode.
Returns
None.
void elmModuleReset ( uint32_t  baseAddr)

This function Resets the ELM.
.

Parameters
baseAddrMemory address of the ELM.
Returns
None.
uint32_t elmModuleResetStatusGet ( uint32_t  baseAddr)

This function gets the software resets status of ELM.
.

Parameters
baseAddrMemory address of the ELM.
Returns
status Reset status :
0 : Module reset is on-going.
1 : Module reset is completed.
uint32_t elmNumOfErrsGet ( uint32_t  baseAddr,
uint32_t  csNum 
)

This function gets the number of errors detected and located during error-location processing.
.

Parameters
baseAddrMemory address of the ELM.
csNumChip Select Number, 0 - 7.
Returns
Number of errors detected and located.
void elmOCPClkActivityConfig ( uint32_t  baseAddr,
uint32_t  configVal 
)

This function sets the OCP Clock activity when module is in IDLE mode.
.

Parameters
baseAddrMemory address of the ELM.
configValConfig value.
This can take one of the following values :
ELM_CLOCKACTIVITYOCP_OCP_OFF – OCP clock is swith off
ELM_CLOCKACTIVITYOCP_OCP_ON – OCP Clock is maintained during wake up period.
Returns
none.
uint32_t elmRevisionGet ( uint32_t  baseAddr)

This function reads the IP revision code of ELM.
.

Parameters
baseAddrMemory address of the ELM.
Returns
ipRev IP revision code of ELM.
void elmSyndromeFrgmtSet ( uint32_t  baseAddr,
uint32_t  synFrgmtId,
uint32_t  synFrgmtVal,
uint32_t  csNum 
)

This function sets the fragments of syndrome polynomial for error-location processing.
.

Parameters
baseAddrMemory address of the ELM.
synFrgmtIdSyndrome fragment ID.
This can take one of the following values :
ELM_SYNDROME_FRGMT_0 - For syndrome fragment 0.
ELM_SYNDROME_FRGMT_1 - For syndrome fragment 1.
ELM_SYNDROME_FRGMT_2 - For syndrome fragment 2.
ELM_SYNDROME_FRGMT_3 - For syndrome fragment 3.
ELM_SYNDROME_FRGMT_4 - For syndrome fragment 4.
ELM_SYNDROME_FRGMT_5 - For syndrome fragment 5.
ELM_SYNDROME_FRGMT_6 - For syndrome fragment 6.
synFrgmtValSyndrome fragment value.
csNumChip Select Number, 0 - 7.
Returns
None.
